revised_title: The Effect of Bacterial Endotoxins on the Opsonizing Action of Rabbit Serum
tldr: This study investigates the effect of injecting intracellular bacterial constituents (bacterial endotoxins) into healthy rabbits and its impact on the opsonizing action of their serum. The results show that endotoxins from different bacteria induce varying degrees of changes in the opsonizing action, with some causing a marked decrease followed by an increase, while others produce a more significant rise in the opsonizing index.
